business.headline: Who files belated ITRs most often? Salaried employees, freelancers or gig workersWho ends up filing belated ITRs most often; salaried employees, freelancers or gig workers? While the Income-tax Department does not release category-wise data, expert observations reveal surprising trends behind delayed filings.

Inside the tax refund limbo: The bigger story behind the 'put on hold' alertsThousands of tax refunds were suddenly put on hold and the message gave no reasons, no timelines. What is really going on inside the income tax system, and why are even honest taxpayers being flagged?

More jobs, higher incomes: New Zealand PM Luxon hails India free trade agreementIndia and New Zealand have successfully concluded a comprehensive Free Trade Agreement, marking a significant milestone in bilateral relations.

Defence personnel get specialised home loan options. Details hereAs competition rises and metro demand cools, housing finance firms are recalibrating strategies, betting on defence families as low-risk, long-term borrowers who need customised loans rather than generic salaried products.

PAN–Aadhaar not linked after December 31? Be ready for penalty and ITR issuesThe December 31 PAN–Aadhaar linking deadline is crucial for taxpayers, as missing it may lead to penalties, ITR filing restrictions, refund delays and higher tax deductions at source.

Sensex, Nifty end lower as year-end rally fizzlesThe BSE Sensex closed at 85,041.45, down 367.25 points or 0.43%, while the NSE Nifty50 settled at 26,042.30, lower by 99.80 points. The session remained volatile, with markets slipping after early stability as investors turned cautious at higher levels.

Is India's housing market entering a new phase of lower sales but higher value?Even though the number of homes sold declined, the overall value of housing sales increased by 6% year-on-year. The total sales value crossed Rs 6 lakh crore in 2025, up from about Rs 5.68 lakh crore in the previous year, mentioned report.

Explained: Why copper prices have hit a record highThe rally is not the result of a single trigger. Instead, it reflects a powerful mix of rising demand, tight supply and supportive global conditions that have reshaped the copper market.

Why are Swiggy, Zomato and Amazon gig workers going on strike on December 31?The strike has been announced by the Telangana Gig and Platform Workers Union along with the Indian Federation of App-Based Transport Workers.

Wonder drug for male baldness puts Swiss firm Cosmo's shares on steroidsStrong trial data has rewritten Cosmo's prospects, but the real test lies ahead as regulators, partners and patients decide whether this promising science can truly deliver commercial success globally eventually.

Sensex tumbles over 400 points: Why is the stock market down today?At 1:02 pm, the BSE Sensex was down 386.20 points to 85,022.50, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 106.80 points to trade at 26,035.30. Most of the broader market indices were also trading in negative territory as volatility rose during the session.

Hindustan Copper shares at 15-year high: What's driving the rallyThe stock has been one of the standout performers in the metal space, and Friday's move reflects a mix of strong commodity trends and sustained investor interest.

Made a mistake in your ITR? Here's how many times you can still revise itIf you think filing your income tax return locks everything in, that is not entirely true. The tax department recognises that genuine mistakes can happen and allows taxpayers to revise their returns, provided they act within the allowed time window.

How will insurance industry trends create new opportunities in 2026?Powered by artificial intelligence, rising climate risks, and changing customer expectations, the insurance industry is now silently transforming itself. Some of the trends that we may see in 2026 could look very different from what most people expect today.

Gold, silver extend record rally: Should you buy now?With gold anchoring portfolios and silver leading returns, should investors keep adding exposure, or step back and wait as record prices test discipline and long-term allocation strategies?

Is India's real estate market entering a more mature and institutional phase?Forces such as digitisation, institutional capital and changing consumer preferences reshaped the sector. More than just building structures, real estate is now about creating ecosystems that are interoperable with transit, logistics, digital infrastructure and services.

What happens if you do not file a revised ITR after your refund is put on holdWhen a return is flagged under the risk management framework, the refund does not move forward on its own. If a taxpayer does not revise the return or respond to the issue flagged, the refund can remain on hold indefinitely, even if the claim is otherwise genuine.

RVNL share price zooms over 11% today. What investors need to knowAt around 10:32 am, the RVNL share price was trading 11.01% higher at Rs 383.75 on the BSE, making it one of the top-performing public sector stocks during the session.

IRFC shares jump over 7% today. Here's what's driving the rallyAt around 10:32 am, IRFC shares were trading 7.42% higher on the BSE at Rs 130.50, emerging as one of the top gainers among public sector stocks during the session.

RVNL, IRFC, IRCTC: Why are these railway stocks rising today?At around 9:55 am, IRCTC was up 1.35% at Rs 688.85 on the BSE, while Rail Vikas Nigam Limited surged 8.94% to Rs 376.60. Indian Railway Finance Corporation also saw strong buying, rising 6.07% to Rs 128.87.

entertainment.headline: Shah Rukh Khan's stardom can be compared to Tom Cruise, Ronaldo: Terry Crews Terry Crews has praised Shah Rukh Khan's international stardom in a recent interview. He drew comparisons with Tom Cruise and Cristiano Ronaldo. The America's Got Talent host also expressed admiration for Bollywood's musical culture.

Tu Meri Main Tera box office Day 3: Kartik's film earns Rs 18.5 crore in India Tu Meri Main Tera Main Tera Tu Meri, led by Kartik Aaryan and Ananya Panday, is witnessing a modest run at the box office. This is amid strong competition from Ranveer Singh's Dhurandhar, which continues to break records both domestically and internationally.

When Section 375 writer accused Akshaye Khanna of dirty politics, claimed ouster As Akshaye Khanna faces scrutiny after reportedly walking out of Drishyam 3, an interview featuring Section 375 writer Manish Gupta has surfaced. In the interview, Gupta alleges Khanna orchestrated his removal as the film's director.

Brigitte Bardot, French icon and global cinema legend, dies at 91 Iconic French actor and singer Brigitte Bardot has died at the age of 91. The global cinema legend was known for her transformative impact on cinema and popular culture. Her legacy includes film stardom, a significant music career, and outspoken political activism.

Huma Qureshi is Elizabeth in Yash's Toxic. Check out first look Huma Qureshi's portrayal of Elizabeth in Yash and Geetu Mohandas's upcoming film Toxic: A Fairytale for Grown-Ups has been revealed, highlighting the film's global ambitions and ensemble technical team ahead of its March 2026 release.

One last time: Atlee's remark wins hearts at  Vijay's Jana Nayagan music launch The audio launch of Jan Neta in Malaysia saw an emotional send-off for Thalapathy Vijay as filmmaker Atlee and fans celebrated the actor's reported final appearance on screen.

Your screen presence is enough: Prabhas praises Sanjay Dutt at Raja Saab event Rebel star Prabhas made a public appearance at The RajaSaab pre-release event in Hyderabad. His praise for Sanjay Dutt's screen presence has raised excitement for the film's release.

Did you know Akshaye Khanna once said nepotism helped him land his first role? Akshaye Khanna has withdrawn from Drishyam 3 after disagreements over remuneration and creative aspects, with producer Kumar Mangat Pathak confirming Jaideep Ahlawat as his replacement and legal action being considered by the production company.

Harry Styles' surprise 8-minute video sparks speculation of fourth solo album Harry Styles has unexpectedly unveiled a new music video for his previously unreleased ballad 'Forever, Forever', sparking discussion amongst fans about his future musical direction and possible tour plans.

Dhurandhar box office day 23: Beats Awara, Dunki and 3 Idiots overseas The espionage thriller Dhurandhar has surpassed major milestones at the Indian box office, entering the top 10 highest earners and setting the stage for a pan-India and global sequel release in 2026.

I broke down: Karan Johar on working with Amitabh Bachchan, Lata Filmmaker Karan Johar has described the intense pressure he faced while directing Amitabh Bachchan and collaborating with Lata Mangeshkar for his second feature film, Kabhi Khushi Kabhie Gham, at just 28 years old.

Dhurandhar, Chhaava, Saiyaara: Heroes battling chaos redeemed Bollywood's 2025 Bollywood's 2025 was redeemed by three films – Dhurandhar, Chhaava and Saiyaara. In their own ways, the heroes of these films scored by battling chaos while flawless machismo in Sikandar, War 2 and Jaat failed to enthuse viewers.

Prabhas' The Raja Saab director makes bold promise to fans. Check it out here At a pre-release event for the upcoming film The Raja Saab, director Maruthi made a public commitment to fans, assuring them of the film's quality and highlighting lead actor Prabhas's performance ahead of its scheduled January 9 release.

Why Dhurandhar worked: Mega success of 2025's biggest blockbuster decoded Ranveer Singh's latest hit 'Dhurandhar' proved that when storytelling meets scale, the big screen wins. OTT may be convenient, but cinema, when done right, remains irreplaceable.

Suniel Shetty says he rejected a Rs 40 crore tobacco ad on principle Suniel Shetty has revealed that he refused a Rs 40 crore tobacco endorsement, stating that personal values, health, and his responsibility as a father outweigh financial incentives.

Unlike any other: Sobhita Dhulipala reviews Ranveer Singh's Dhurandhar Actor Shobhita Dhulipala shared her review of Aditya Dhar directorial Dhurandhar. The sequel of the film is scheduled for release on March 19, 2026.

Athiya Shetty shares unseen photo of Evaarah with KL Rahul on first Christmas Athiya Shetty posted photos on Instagram on December 27, offering a look at her holiday celebrations with cricketer KL Rahul and their daughter Evaarah.

Thalapathy Vijay raises his fist in joy as fans say 2026 is ours. Viral video Actor Vijay responded to a fan's proclamation about 2026 elections with a symbolic gesture during the Jana Nayagan audio launch in Malaysia. The video is now going viral.

How Salman Khan met my mother Kunickaa after 30 years: Ayaan Lall reveals Actor Salman Khan had an unexpected reunion with actor Kunickaa Sadanand, facilitated by her son and fellow actor Ayaan Lall, during the filming of their latest project. The interaction occurred over three decades after their last collaboration, creating a memorable moment on set.

general news.headline: Bangladesh calls attack on Hindus 'isolated incidents of criminal acts'Bangladesh calls attack on Hindus 'isolated incidents of criminal acts' after India flags systemic persecution

2 of Osman Hadi killers fled to India via Meghalaya border: Dhaka PoliceTwo prime suspects in the murder of Bangladeshi political activist Osman Hadi have fled to India through the Meghalaya border, police said. The Bangladesh government is actively communicating with Indian authorities for their arrest and extradition.

Bengaluru man flees after wife's suicide, travels 1,000 km, kills self in NagpurFearing police action, victim Suraj and his mother Jayanti fled to Nagpur after his newly-wed wife Ganavi allegedly died by suicide over dowry harassment. Jayanti survived the suicide attempt.

Return to the womb? Bangladesh students party NCP joins Islamist Jamaat-e-IslamiThe National Citizen Party (NCP), formed by leaders of the July Agitation that removed Sheikh Hasina's government, has decided to ally with the Islamist Jamaat-e-Islami ahead of Bangladesh polls. The decision to join the Jamaat, which had opposed Bangladesh's liberation from Pakistan, saw several NCP leaders quit the party.

How Indian techies became new Communists for AmericansSuch was the fear and hate for Communists in the US, spouses used to spy on their partners. That same paranoia now seems to have been reserved for Indian techies. But how did Indians, who helped build Silicon Valley, become such subject of hate?

16-hour wait for bed in emergency: Why Canada's healthcare system is in ICUAn Indian-origin father of three young kids died at an Edmonton hospital despite crying for a bed for eight hours. Canada-based Indians say it could take up to 16 hours to get medical treatment in emergency rooms and months for doctor appointments. What is ailing the healthcare system of Canada, considered a developed country?

Muslims are...: When Brigitte Bardot was fined for anti-Islam remarksBrigitte Bardot's career was not only marked by stardom and animal-rights activism, but also by repeated convictions for "inciting racial hatred". French courts fined her repeatedly for remarks in which she accused Muslims of "destroying" France and "imposing" their practices.

India vs Sri Lanka Live Score, 4th Women's T20I: India aim to continue dominant runIndia Women vs Sri Lanka Women, 4th T20I Live Score: After claiming the series 3-0, Harmanpreet Kaur's troops will be looking to extend their lead. The visitors, on the other hand, will look to salvage some pride with an improved performance.

India helped free Bangladesh. Why is it then a target of public rage?Bangladesh's anti-India sentiment, long an undercurrent shaped by history, geography and political rivalry, has intensified over the past decade as Sheikh Hasina's rule became increasingly identified with New Delhi's backing. Here's how it took shape, from the 1976 protests to the unrest of 2025.

Pak President urged to move to bunkers during Op Sindoor, Asif Ali Zardari admitsIndia's precise military strikes following the Pahalgam terror attack triggered high alert in Pakistan, with President Zardari revealing bunker warnings. The escalation led to intense cross-border shelling before a ceasefire was agreed upon.

Limbs tied, burn marks on face: Young woman's body found in Noida dumping yardPolice said they are examining CCTV footage from nearby areas and checking missing persons' records as part of the investigation. All possible angles are being probed.

Humayun Kabir's son detained for assaulting cop deployed in father's securityThe personal security officer, who is a part of Humayun Kabir's security, has alleged that Kabir's son, Golam Nabi Azad, assaulted him.

The jobs Gen Z ditched in 2025, and what replaced themIn 2025, Gen Z began moving away from traditional career paths as entry-level roles shrank and AI changed hiring. From rigid corporate jobs to the idea of dream careers, young workers quietly pivoted towards skills, flexibility, gig work and practical roles that offered control and stability.

They went to Germany for degrees. Now Indian students face deportationHundreds of Indian students enrolled at a Berlin university are facing visa uncertainty and possible deportation instead of graduation. Confusion over hybrid course recognition and changing visa interpretations has left students stuck between authorities and universities, raising serious questions about Germany's international education system.

As good as DMV: Musk slams Canada's healthcare over Indian-origin man's deathPrashant Sreekumar, father of three, died on December 22 after being brought to the hospital after he complained of severe chest pain while at work.

Brigitte Bardot, French icon and global cinema legend, dies at 91Iconic French actor and singer Brigitte Bardot has died at the age of 91. The global cinema legend was known for her transformative impact on cinema and popular culture. Her legacy includes film stardom, a significant music career, and outspoken political activism.

No one has guts: Madhya Pradesh councillor's husband threatens woman he rapedA BJP councillor's husband was arrested in Madhya Pradesh after a survivor accused him of rape, harassment, and threats. The action followed a viral video in which he allegedly flaunted influence and dared her to complain.

Ft. Sharib Hashmi aka JK on love, self-doubt, and being a 'family man' all alongYears of struggle, financial crisis, insecurities, and then fame, Sharib Hashmi has been smiling through it all. This week on 'Anything But,' he shares his slice of life as a true family man.

Watch: Kilauea volcano's lava devils whirl like fiery tornadoesVolcano Kilauea's puahiohio are swirling columns of ash and volcanic debris, often mistaken for tornadoes but formed by intense lava heat.

Driverless robotaxis are going global, but the self-driving dream still hits bumpsFor nearly a century, humanity has chased the ghost of the self-driving car, a dream first flickering on silver screens in 1927's Metropolis. But in 2025, that dream has finally ditched the projector for the pavement. What was once a high-stakes laboratory experiment is now a $2 billion global industry. India Today Tech takes a look.

Gautam Gambhir's future as Test coach secure: BCCI dismisses replacement rumoursThe BCCI has firmly dismissed speculation around Gautam Gambhir's Test future. Secretary Devajit Saikia confirmed no replacement talks have taken place and that Gambhir will continue as head coach under his existing contract.

Who is Jerrssis Wadia? India-born Australian batter lights up BBL with 24-run over India-born Jerrssis Wadia burst onto the BBL stage with a blistering 34 off 16, including a 24-run over against Brisbane Heat, announcing himself as a rising star for the Adelaide Strikers in the 2025–26 season.

Is Green's lack of self-belief reason behind poor form? Ex-Aus captain reacts Former Australia captain Mark Taylor feels that a lack of self-belief is the reason behind Cameron Green's poor form in the ongoing Ashes 2025-26 series. Green has struggled with both bat and ball as his spot in the side has come under the scanner.

Ex-captain rues England's super-late 'Eureka moment' after Boxing Day Test win Ashes: Former England captain Geoffrey Boycott is ruing the fact that England realised their lengths very late in the series. England finally won a Test match in the Ashes, while playing the Boxing Day game at the MCG.

Travis Head defends Jake Weatherald, sees promise despite Ashes setbacks AUS vs ENG: Travis Head urged patience with Jake Weatherald after a tough Ashes start, saying difficult conditions and early pressure should not define a player he believes is ready for international cricket.

PM Modi praises India for memorable 2025: Daughters of Bharat created history Prime Minister Narendra Modi hailed 2025 as a landmark year for Indian sport, highlighted by historic cricket triumphs across men's, women's and blind teams and a breakthrough showing by para-athletes.

SCG Test ideal place for Usman Khawaja's Australia swansong: Brett Lee Brett Lee feels that the Sydney Test in front of his home crowd would be the ideal setting for Usman Khawaja's retirement from the game. Khawaja has struggled for form in 2025.n

Former Delhi Capitals batter smacks joint-fastest Women's T20 fifty Former Delhi Capitals batter Laura Harris smashed a joint-fastest 15-ball fifty, blasting 52 off 17 balls to power Otago to a six-wicket win over Canterbury in the Women's Super Smash 2025-26.

Aryna Sabalenka vs Nick Kyrgios, Battle of the Sexes: All you need to know Aryna Sabalenka and Nick Kyrgios face off in a special 'Battle of the Sexes' exhibition. Here's when the match is being played, how to watch it live, and the rules that will be in place.

Pace legend Brett Lee honoured with Australian cricket Hall of Fame induction Legendary fast bowler Brett Lee has been officially inducted into the Australian Cricket Hall of Fame. Lee represented Australia in 76 Tests, 221 ODIs and 25 T20Is, amassing a combined total of 718 wickets.

Abhishek Sharma checks in for Vijay Hazare Trophy 2025: WatchVijay Hazare Trophy 2025: Abhishek Sharma fine-tuned his bowling ahead of Punjab's Vijay Hazare Trophy match, while Shubman Gill's possible return after injury adds intrigue ahead of the Uttarakhand clash.

CSK's Jadeja 2.0? Akeal Hosein makes instant impact in SA20 opener, impresses AshwinAkeal Hosein impressed on SA20 debut with a quick 22 and figures of 1/19 for Joburg Super Kings, earning praise from Ravichandran Ashwin. Good signs for Chennai Super Kings' recent acquisition at the IPL auction?

Kohli showers praise on Gujarat's Vishal Jayswal after being dismissed by himVijay Hazare Trophy: Virat Kohli praised Gujarat's Vishal Jayswal after being his victim in the Vijay Hazare Trophy. Jayswal registered figures of 4/42 in ten overs after dismissing Kohli and Rishabh Pant.

Gautam Gambhir's future as Test coach secure: BCCI dismisses replacement rumoursThe BCCI has firmly dismissed speculation around Gautam Gambhir's Test future. Secretary Devajit Saikia confirmed no replacement talks have taken place and that Gambhir will continue as head coach under his existing contract.

MCG curator left shocked after Ashes Test ends in 2 days: Didn't go as per planAshes 2025-26: Melbourne Cricket Ground (MCG) pitch curator Matt Page revealed that he was left shocked following a two-day finish in the fourth Ashes Test. England beat Australia by four wickets as the game ended within 142 overs.

Pakistan kabaddi player banned for playing with India-linked team in private eventPakistani kabaddi star Ubaidullah Rajput has been banned indefinitely by the Pakistan Kabaddi Federation after representing an Indian team at a private tournament in Bahrain, with the federation citing violation of no-objection certificate protocols.

I am jealous: Travis Head taunts media scrutiny over Ben Duckett Noosa drinking rowTravis Head came out strongly in defence of Ben Duckett amid the Noosa controversy. The Australian opener said he reached out personally, insisting players deserve understanding despite the constant scrutiny of elite cricket.

Babar, Rizwan, Afridi, Rauf to skip Sri Lanka T20Is for BBL commitmentsPakistan tour of Sri Lanka: Babar Azam, Mohammad Rizwan, Shaheen Afridi and Haris Rauf will skip the Sri Lanka T20I series due to Big Bash League duties. The three-match series will begin on January 7 in Sri Lanka.

Pride, now paid: How BCCI turned Indian cricket into a high-paying professionFrom Rs 2,100 match fees to Rs 7-crore contracts, we examine how the BCCI's broadcast boom, central contracts and domestic pay hikes transformed Indian cricket from a passion sustained by jobs into a full-time profession.

Watch: Liverpool's touching tribute as Van Dijk leads Diogo Jota's kids out at AnfieldAnfield stood united in remembrance as Liverpool paid a moving tribute to Diogo Jota. From chants to symbolic gestures, football paused briefly as players, fans and family honoured a cherished figure.

The heist in the humidity: How Jimmy Gressier stole the worldJimmy Gressier shocked the world by winning the 10,000m race at Tokyo 2025. His victory ended decades of African dominance and signalled a new era in long-distance running.

Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli in 2025: A year India learnt to savour Ro-Ko2025 did not close with grand farewells for Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli. Instead, it unfolded as a year of quiet endings, shifting roles and timely reminders of why Indian cricket still leans on them.

RCB tribute? Paarl Royals get all out for 49 in SA20, fans start memefestPaarl Royals were bowled out for just 49 runs, the lowest score in SA20 history against Sunrisers Eastern Cape. The collapse sparked social media comparisons with RCB's infamous 2017 batting failure against Kolkata Knight Riders.

Women's Hockey India League 2025-26: Squads, schedule and all you need to knowThe Women's Hockey India League is set for its second season with four teams battling it out for the title. Here's all that you need to know about the upcoming season of the tournament being played in Ranchi.

Watch: Rohit Sharma signs Dhawal Kulkarni's glove in heartfelt Mumbai reunionRohit Sharma shared a touching moment with former teammate Dhawal Kulkarni in Jaipur. From signing gloves to scoring big runs, Rohit's Vijay Hazare return ended with eyes firmly on India duty.

From Belgium with love: Hendrickx brings a champion's edge to Kalinga LancersA legend of the game, Alexander Hendrickx brings a champion's edge to the Hockey India League as the Kalinga Lancers eye a revival during the 2025-26 season. Hendrickx talks about the team's goals, Belgiums transitions and his role as a mentor for the youngsters in the Lancers squad.

Series in the bag, India Women eye bench strength testing against lifeless Sri LankaIND vs SL, 4th WT20I: After winning the series 3-0, India will be looking to chop and change and test out their best strength. Sri Lanka, on the other hand, will look to salvage some pride and make sure they avoid a cleansweep.

Bring Virat Kohli out of Test retirement: Navjot Sidhu reveals his one wish to godNavjot Singh Sidhu has made an emotional appeal for Virat Kohli's Test return. Citing Kohli's elite fitness and form, Sidhu believes a comeback would unite and uplift Indian cricket fans nationwide.

Rishabh Pant to be dropped from New Zealand ODI series: SourcesRishabh Pant is set to be dropped from India's ODI squad for the New Zealand series. His absence could open the door for in-form Ishan Kishan to return to the ODI setup, or Jitesh Sharma receiving his maiden call-up.

Wirtz will score many more goals for Liverpool: Slot backs star after Wolves winnerFlorian Wirtz finally announced himself at Anfield with a decisive Wolves winner. Backed firmly by Arne Slot, the Liverpool midfielder now enters a crucial January stretch with confidence growing around his long-term impact.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
